intro: Bellida graminea, commonly known as the grass bellidium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
